lines.text: That's a good point, Bernard. That's a fully-fledged bastard of a good point.
If you ever need anything, you just call and I'll be up there faster than a poker up a pervert.
So all I have to do is wish?
As far as I know; the training for this stupid job is practically nonexistent.
Say the words "I wish" with the caution you would normally reserve for "Please castrate me."
the loving relatives, the priest, the staggeringly-attractive best man, the shagged-out bridesmaids...
One day I was in the Temple when they tried to turn it into a supermarket; Jesus went in there and kicked ass!
Like Arnold Schwarzenegger.
Yes, but with smaller pectorals.
But now, I'm as happy as Michelle Pfeiffer's underpants.
Suddenly my gold fountainpen has gone missing. I am therefore yours in crayon.
As you know, Mr. Bottle left us yesterday, and I've been worrying about it. Do either of you think I was a little harsh on him?

[carefully]
Well sir... I think perhaps you might... have given him a warning...
Good, good. You're fired. I want you out of here immediately, you disastrously faded old crone! Exit ye, exit ye!
And you are a very large turd in a horrible pink shirt.
I beg your BLOODY pardon?
Bugger ye off!
You smell of peppermint and now it is time to die!
[after trying ice cream for the first time]
It's really cold and it tastes exactly of strawberries!
Originally, it was supposed to celebrate the birth of this chap called Jesus Christ, who was born, well, about 2000 years ago.
Jesus, you say?
Yeah.
But I knew this guy.
You did not!
I did, I mean, what did he do to get so famous?
Well, he turned out to be the Son of God.
No! I thought he was kidding.
A little more negotiation and the match will be made. Depending, of course, on proof of child-bearing capability.
So, is that your flying carpet, then?
Yes, it is! Would you fancy for a ride?
Oh no. The reindeer can get very jealous if I use alternative means of transportation.
Very amusing. Now, down to business. Naturally, the question of the dowry raises it's ugly head.
Sorry, he's not from around here.

[after having insulted the police]
Do you... wish I'd never said any of that?

[smiling]
Yes I do!
